thread.title: Politics 204 for October 20
thread.title_full: Politics 204 for October 20 - Winnipeg Free Press

author: winnipegfreepress.com
title: Politics 204 for October 20
text:
Quote: of the day Incoming prime minister Justin Trudeau waves to supporters during his acceptance speech at Liberal party headquarters in Montreal Monday night. “Sunny ways, my friends. This is what positive politics can do.” — Prime minister-designate Justin Trudeau in his victory speech last night in Montreal after Trudeau and the Liberals won a resounding majority. Back to business Mayor Brian Bowman What does business have to say?: Corporate Canada is sizing up the Liberal majority and what it could mean for their bottom lines, with the construction industry particularly poised to benefit from Justin Trudeau’s promises to boost infrastructure spending. Bowman anniversary: Brian Bowman is about to celebrate a milestone — his first anniversary as mayor of Winnipeg. Our editorial looks at his term so far, and while we think he’s improving, he still has a long way to go. Smartening up?: Lost in all the election attention Monday night was a sign of wisdom from Winnipeg School Division trustees, who postponed their long-scheduled public delegation meeting until next month. In case you missed it The Blue Jays' Kevin Pillar celebrates scoring Snuck in?: A report only made available on election day absolved Manitoba Hydro of responsibility for Lake Winnipeg flooding. However, Hydro but must jump through new hoops before it wins the right to permanently regulate levels on the world’s 10th-largest lake. Banning moose hunts: The Manitoba government is banning moose hunts this fall. The reason: declining numbers. Today in history Jays win: The Toronto Blue Jays won the World Series in 1992 on this date. Let’s call for a repeat. The Free Press Politics: 204 is published weekday afternoons.
